intro: Descurainia paradisa subsp. nevadensis, commonly known as the Nevada sweet rocket, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, clustered flowers and pinnately divided leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The subspecies is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and slightly different morphology compared to other members of the species.
